intro: Thouinia variifolia, commonly known as the variable thouinia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that vary in shape and size, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
